alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 10:34AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Hancock, Henderson, southern Warren, northern McDonough, southeastern Henry, southern Des Moines, southeastern Van Buren, Lee, eastern Scotland and Clark Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1033 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bushnell to near Burnside to 7 miles southwest of Wayland. Movement was north at 25 to 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... La Harpe, Colusa, Disco and Adrian around 1040 AM CDT. Wayland and Terre Haute around 1050 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Dallas City, St. Francisville, Kahoka, Carman, Roseville, Luray, Gulf Port, Iowa Army Ammunition Plant, Burlington, Monmouth, West Burlington, Kirkwood, Middletown and Croton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren
